Beyoglu: Things to Do

Beyoglu, one of Istanbul’s liveliest areas, was formerly Pera or Galata. It is an ideal place to witness the architectural influences of the Ottoman Empire. Moreover, it is possible to come across traces of different cultures.

This district serves as the cultural center of Istanbul, a cosmopolitan and exotic city. Just for this reason alone, it is worth visiting! So, where are the places to visit in Beyoglu? Let’s start with the heart of Beyoglu, which is Istiklal Avenue.

1- Istiklal Avenue

Istiklal Avenue, vibrant at all hours in Istanbul, is a favorite spot for every visitor. It acts like a magnet, attracting both local and foreign tourists. This is because it houses buildings that have witnessed history and belong to different cultures.

You can find stores of many world-renowned brands as well as local shops. Additionally, there are restaurants, cafes, and bars where you can enjoy delicious meals. Let’s remember the art galleries and museums as well.

2- Cihangir Street

Now, it’s time to talk about Cihangir, famous for its streets in Istanbul and cafes! Cihangir is a colorful neighborhood, starting from Siraselviler Avenue.

Cihangir is a neighborhood where painters and theater artists live. It is also famous for its cats. Besides, you can find art galleries and cozy cafes where you can enjoy your time.

While wandering around Cihangir, you may come across other exciting destinations. Among these, Cihangir Mosque and Cukurcuma Turkish Bath stand out. If you enjoy collecting antiques, you might like the Antiques Bazaar. While you’re here, you can also visit the Museum of Innocence.

3- Karakoy

Beyoglu is rich in historical sites, and the place to visit there is Karakoy. Karakoy is a neighborhood with historic buildings.

You can start with Bankalar Street, where you will encounter many historical structures. Additionally, the Kamondo Stairs and the French Passage are other destinations you must see.

You can walk along the Karakoy, or you can enjoy your drinks at the cafes. If you are interested in shopping, you can visit Galataport.

Galataport, which includes the world’s first underground cruise port, offers a beautiful shopping experience. You can find the best breakfast Beyoglu here. You’ll find a delicious breakfast menu accompanied by Turkish tea on breakfast street. There are also traditional Turkish breakfast places in Istanbul, Galataport.

Moreover, you can visit Modern Istanbul, Turkey’s first modern art museum, there.

4- Taksim Square

Taksim is one of the busiest and liveliest places in Istanbul. It is bustling 24/7, and Istanbul Taksim Square is always a favorite meeting point.

The famous Istiklal Avenue, featured in songs and movies, is also in Taksim. There are so many places to visit on Istiklal Avenue! Let’s find out where to visit Taksim Beyoglu and what to do in Taksim.

5- Galata Tower

Galata Tower is one of the iconic landmarks of Istanbul. Located in the Beyoglu district, the tower was built by the Byzantine Emperor Anastasius.

A must-visit destination for tourists, the tower was initially constructed as a lighthouse. Galata Tower has many legends associated with it, and you can enjoy a magnificent view.

6- Taksim: Pera Museum

If you happen to be in Beyoglu, you can visit the Pera Museum. It ranks high on the list of places to visit in Beyoglu. The museum is in the Tepebasi neighborhood of Beyoglu.

Established in 2005, the museum offers Osman Hamdi Bey’s famous painting, “The Tortoise Trainer.” Pera Museum is a delightful and fascinating place for art enthusiasts.

7- St. Antuan Church

Beyoglu is a district with many cultures, so it hosts numerous mosques, churches, and synagogues. Among them, St. Anthony of Padua Church receives significant attention.

The church attracts many local and foreign tourists due to its impressive architecture. Another reason for its popularity is its location on Istiklal Avenue. St. Anthony of Padua Church could be the most popular place on Istiklal Avenue!

Beyoglu Historic Places

Beyoglu, one of the central districts of Istanbul, has a rich history. It is an area with European-style settlements adorned with majestic buildings.

If you want to see Art Nouveau-style design, you are at the right place! The streets of Beyoglu are adorned with eye-catching consulate buildings as well. Mainly the buildings of the Netherlands Consulate and the Belgium Consulate leave viewers in awe.

Galata Bridge

Galata Bridge is one of the symbols of Istanbul. Have you ever walked from Eminonu to Karakoy? This bridge connects the neighborhoods of Eminonu and Karakoy.

Due to its iconic status in Istanbul, the bridge is frequently seen in movies. Galata Bridge is a bustling bridge that offers a magnificent view of Istanbul. You can always come across people fishing on the bridge.

Taksim: Things to Do

Taksim and its surroundings are the cultural and artistic center of Istanbul. Therefore, the list of things to do in Taksim is quite extensive. There is no limit! Let’s start with a list of places to visit in Taksim Beyoglu.

Taksim Foods

There are popular Beyoglu restaurants in Taksim. There are restaurants where you can enjoy delicious meals. Moreover, Beyoglu is also known for its street food! You can buy chocolate from the Istiklal Street shops that sell Beyoglu chocolate.

If you want to find new tastes, you can try Iranian restaurants in Taksim. There are also many delicious Beyoglu grill restaurants, such as Zubeyir Ocakbasi Taksim Turkish Grill.

How to Reach Taksim?

Metro

Istanbul’s metro network is well-connected, and you can use the metro to reach Beyoglu. Take the M2 line, and get off at Taksim Square station. But there is no metro from Taksim to Sultanahmet.

Tram

If you are from the Sultanahmet area, you can take the T1 tram line. Get off at the last stop, Kabatas, and from there.

Ferry

If you are Asian side, you can take a ferry to Karakoy.

Airport Transfer

If you want to go from Istanbul’s airports to Taksim, you can use Havabus Taksim.
